lines.value: the cooperative commonwealth federation manitoba ccf known informally as the manitoba ccf was a provincial branch of the national canadian party by the same name
lines.name: English

lines.value: the national ccf was the dominant social democratic party in canada from the 1930s to the early 1960s when it merged with the labour movement to become the new democratic party
lines.name: English

lines.value: the manitoba ccf created in 1932 played the same role at the provincial level
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was initially a small organization and was supported by members of the independent labour party which had existed in the province since 1920
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ilp and ccf were brought into a formal alliance in 1933 despite misgivings from some in the former party
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ilp was the leading social democratic party in manitoba prior to the ccf's formation
lines.name: English

lines.value: it had a reliable support base in winnipeg and other urban areas but had virtually no organization in the countryside
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ccf was formed to bring labour and farm groups into the same political camp
lines.name: English

lines.value: some ilp members saw this as diluting their party's integrity
lines.name: English

lines.value: the provincial ccf had become stronger by 1936 and the ilp's candidates in that year's provincial election were referred to as ilp ccf
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the election some disgruntled ilp members succeeded in temporarily disaffiliating the parties
lines.name: English

lines.value: pressure from david lewis and j s woodsworth brought about a quick realignment but relations remained strained
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the start of world war ii the ilp and ccf were again in disagreement the ilp supported an all out war effort whereas the ccf supported the conscription of wealth rather than men
lines.name: English

lines.value: this controversy contributed to the defeat of federal ccf mp abraham albert heaps in the election of 1940
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ccf eventually gained control of the ilp's internal organization and the two parties were effectively one after 1941
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ilp formally disbanded in 1943
lines.name: English

lines.value: in late 1940 the ilp ccf accepted an offer by manitoba premier john bracken to become part of an all party unity government
lines.name: English

lines.value: this decision was opposed by some national leaders including david lewis but was supported by local figures such as seymour farmer who had led the ilp parliamentary group since 1935
lines.name: English

lines.value: on november 4 1940 farmer became the first socialist politician in canadian history to attain cabinet rank having been sworn in as minister of labour
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ccf's experience in the coalition government was a disappointment to the party
lines.name: English

lines.value: the party leaders had hoped to use their influence to promote progressive labour legislation instead bracken's government forced farmer to seek free votes on his ministry's initiatives these soon became party votes with the ccf invariably losing
lines.name: English

lines.value: farmer resigned from government in december 1942 and the ccf formally left the coalition in 1943
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ccf's time in government demoralized its membership and hindered its electoral fortunes voters elected only three ccf mlas in 1941
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the next few years the ccf's primary concern was preventing infiltration from communists then officially represented by the labour progressive party
lines.name: English

lines.value: some figures in the lpp favoured cooperation with the ccf the ccf leadership was fully opposed to this and suspended two prominent manitoba mlas when they advocated formal cooperation
lines.name: English

lines.value: accusations of being communist sympathizers would hinder the party's fortunes for years to come
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1944 the national party was performing well in the polls and a ccf government was elected in neighbouring saskatchewan
lines.name: English

lines.value: the manitoba ccf hoped to repeat this success the following year but won only 10 seats out of 55
lines.name: English

lines.value: this failure was due in part to the province's outdated electoral boundaries which favoured rural ridings at the expense of the cities
lines.name: English

lines.value: farmer resigned as party leader in 1947 and was replaced the following year by edwin hansford
lines.name: English

lines.value: the party won only seven seats in the election of 1949 amid a period of generally poor fortunes for left wing parties in canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: hansford resigned as leader in 1952 replaced by scottie bryce
lines.name: English

lines.value: the selection of bryce was somewhat unusual in that he was a federal mp without experience in the provincial house
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was apparently chosen as party leader due to fears that his federal seat would be eliminated by redistribution
lines.name: English

lines.value: bryce ultimately decided against joining provincial politics and was replaced by lloyd stinson before the 1953 election
lines.name: English

lines.value: stinson was probably the most adept of the manitoba ccf's leaders but he was unable to translate his personal popularity and charisma into victory at the polls
lines.name: English

lines.value: the party fell to five seats in 1953 during the first election to be held after the province's liberal conservative coalition dissolved amid acrimony
lines.name: English

lines.value: the liberal government of douglas campbell became increasingly unpopular in the mid 1950s and the ccf was able to tap into some of the public's discontent
lines.name: English

lines.value: stinson was relatively popular among the province's centre left voters and the ccf increased its seat total to eleven in 1958
lines.name: English

lines.value: the primary benefactors of campbell's unpopularity however were the progressive conservatives under dufferin roblin who won 26 seats out of 57
lines.name: English

lines.value: the campbell government initially attempted to stay in power through an alliance with the ccf which turned down this offer perhaps due to the disappointment of 1940-43
lines.name: English

lines.value: roblin was sworn in as premier later in the year
lines.name: English

lines.value: roblin's government put the ccf in a paradoxical situation as the new premier initiated long overdue progressive legislation and outflanked the ccf in a bid for centre left voters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ccf was forced to lend support to roblin's initiatives thereby providing his ministry with the legislative record it needed to win a majority the following year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tories won 38 seats the following year with the ccf dropping to 10
lines.name: English

lines.value: stinson resigned as party leader in 1960 and was replaced by russ paulley
lines.name: English

lines.value: the national ccf had fallen to eight seats in 1958 losing much of its support to john diefenbaker's tories
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the national party reinvented itself in 1961 as the new democratic party via an alliance with the canadian labour congress the provincial ccf followed suit
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new party in manitoba affiliated with the manitoba federation of labour and paulley became the first provincial ndp leader later in 1961
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ccf ceased to exist having been superseded by the new democratic party of manitoba in much the same way as it had previously superseded the ilp
lines.name: English

lines.value: ran as the ilp ccf in 1932 seats compared to the independent labour party's 5 seats in the previous election
lines.name: English

lines.value: miranda ( ) is one of the principal characters of william shakespeare's the tempest
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is the only female character to appear on stage during the course of the play and is one of only four women mentioned claribel sycorax miranda's mother and miranda
lines.name: English

lines.value: miranda is the daughter of prospero one of the main characters of william shakespeare's the tempest
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was banished to the island along with her father at the age of three and in the subsequent twelve years has lived with her father and their slave caliban as her only company
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is openly compassionate and unaware of the evils of the world that surrounds her learning of her father's fate only as the play begins
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is some speculation that miranda along with her husband ferdinand may be intended to represent elizabeth stuart and her new spouse elector frederick v as the tempest was originally performed for the court of elizabeth's father king james in celebration of the marriage
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tempest's second scene begins with miranda begging her father to spare the lives of the men at sea
lines.name: English

lines.value: she's fully aware of the powers prospero possesses and begs him to cease the storm
lines.name: English

lines.value: in an act of bravery she challenges her father's wisdom arguing that had i been any god of power i would have sunk the sea within the earth or ere it should the good ship so have swallow'd and the souls within her as the scene progresses it is revealed to her that she is in fact the princess of milan
lines.name: English

lines.value: when ariel prospero's servant appears miranda is placed into a magically induced sleep
lines.name: English

lines.value: she awakens when caliban is summoned and it is quickly shown that the two have a contentious relationship most probably due to caliban's failed attempt to violate her honor she refers to him as a villain sir i do not love to look on i ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the moment with caliban progresses miranda rebukes caliban for the hatred he expresses towards her father abhorred slave which any print of goodness wilt not take being capable of all ill
lines.name: English

lines.value: i pitied thee took pains to make thee speak taught thee each hour one thing or other when thou didst not savage know thine own meaning but wouldst like a thing most i endow'd thy purposes with words that made them known
lines.name: English

lines.value: but thy vile race though thou didst learn had that in't which good natures could not abide to be with therefore wast thou deservedly confined into this rock who hadst deserved more than a prison
lines.name: English

lines.value: moments later she encounters ferdinand for the first time and the two immediately fall in love
lines.name: English

lines.value: miranda is amazed by the sight of him questioning whether or not he is a spirit
lines.name: English

lines.value: while prospero is pleased by the immediate connection the two display he purposefully takes up an attitude of towards the shipwrecked prince forbidding a relationship between the two in order that ferdinand will place a higher value on his daughter's affection
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the encounter miranda once again stands up to her father arguing against his harsh treatment of ferdinand and defending his honour when prospero refers to him as nothing more than another caliban
lines.name: English

lines.value: miranda's next appearance is in the third act
lines.name: English

lines.value: she and ferdinand take a few moments together to get acquainted and are quickly married
lines.name: English

lines.value: she insists on doing the work that her father has assigned him and freely admits her naivety to him before swearing her love for him
lines.name: English

lines.value: the scene ends with their marriage miranda swearing she will be his servant if ferdinand will not take her as his wife
lines.name: English

lines.value: later on she and her new husband enjoy a masque put on by her father in celebration of their nuptials
lines.name: English

lines.value: the celebration is interrupted by prospero's sudden remembrance of caliban's plot against him after which miranda displays a strong concern for her father's well being
lines.name: English

lines.value: her last appearance is in the play's final scene
lines.name: English

lines.value: after prospero reveals himself to the assembled crowd he reveals the happy couple engaged in a game of chess
lines.name: English

lines.value: miranda is teasing ferdinand for cheating but admits that even if he is dishonest she's more than happy to believe it for the love she bears for him
lines.name: English

lines.value: when she is finally introduced to the assembled crowd she reacts with wonder proclaiming the play's most famous lines o wonder
lines.name: English

lines.value: how many goodly creatures are there here
lines.name: English

lines.value: how beauteous mankind is
lines.name: English

lines.value: o brave new world that has such people in't
lines.name: English

lines.value: traditional gendered criticism of the tempest interprets miranda as a living representation of female virtue
lines.name: English

lines.value: as is mentioned in the main article miranda is typically viewed as having completely internalised the patriarchal order of things believing herself to be subordinate towards her father
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is loving kind and compassionate as well as obedient to her father and is described as perfect and peerless created of every creature's best
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is furthermore the only female character within a cast of strong male figures and much of her interaction on stage is dominated by the male figures around her
lines.name: English

lines.value: miranda's behaviour is typically seen as completely dictated by prospero from her interactions with caliban to her ultimate decision to marry ferdinand
lines.name: English

lines.value: the traits that make the of femininity are the same traits that her her innocence and vulnerability are seen as the things that allow her to be readily manipulated first by her father and then ferdinand
lines.name: English

lines.value: however various critics argue that those same feminine traits enable her to be a strong female presence with important effects on the play's outcome
lines.name: English

lines.value: throughout the course of the play miranda acts as a foil to prospero's more violent instincts and serves as a sounding board to move the play's plot further
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is also a central figure in her father's revenge enabling prospero to gain political through her marriage to the prince of naples ferdinand
lines.name: English

lines.value: furthermore while miranda is very much subservient to prospero's power some critics argue that her obedience is a conscious choice
lines.name: English

lines.value: miranda proves herself willing to challenge prospero's power first by calling into question his treatment of the shipwrecked sailors and then defying his commandment to have nothing to do with prince ferdinand
lines.name: English

lines.value: her decision to pursue a relationship with ferdinand is also interpreted by critics as an indication that her marriage to him is more than a simple political match
lines.name: English

lines.value: miranda makes a very clear decision to seek out ferdinand and offer her assistance all the while worrying that her father will discover them
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is also the one to abandon traditional concepts of elizabethan modesty by ardently stating her love for ferdinand proclaiming that i am your wife if you will marry me if not i'll die your maid
lines.name: English

lines.value: critics also argue that miranda's feminine presence is essential to the central theme of the play
lines.name: English

lines.value: miranda's influence is what dulls the worst of her father's anger prospero cites her as being his reason for living after their initial banishment and he informs her that everything he does is in care of her
lines.name: English

lines.value: michael neill argues that miranda's function on the island is that of a christ figure that she is the indicator of a given character's moral status within the social hierarchy of the island and that she also serves to protect the ethical code of the island's inhabitants and visitors
lines.name: English

lines.value: caliban whom she rejects is shown to be a monstrous figure while ferdinand whom she embraces is saved by her presence her sympathy lightening the baseness of his given task
lines.name: English

lines.value: critic melissa sanchez analyses miranda in a similar light discussing her as a representation of an angelic but passive soul caught in the conflict between enlightenment and base desire represented by prospero and caliban
lines.name: English

lines.value: critic lorie leininger argues that miranda fits into the colonialist interpretation of the tempest in that prospero's use of miranda as an unwitting player in his political revenge is expressive of the play's sexist attitude towards women
lines.name: English

lines.value: leininger equates that the sexist attitudes displayed towards miranda are equitable to the s of racism shown in the treatment of caliban
lines.name: English

lines.value: she states that prospero's treatment of miranda is in essence the same as his treatment of caliban describing his attitude towards both as indicative of their within the social hierarchy of the island
lines.name: English

lines.value: leininger also argues that miranda's sexualisation is a weapon used against her by her father stating that prospero uses caliban's attempted assault and ferdinand's romantic overtures to her simplifying her into a personification of chastity
lines.name: English

lines.value: in leininger's analysis caliban is treated in a similar fashion forced into the role of an uncivilised savage without heed for his individual needs and desires much in the same way that miranda is expected to marry ferdinand and reject caliban's advances simply because her father wishes it
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the tempest is most frequently analysed in the modern day as a retelling of british colonial history miranda does not make an appearance in the majority of such criticism
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the play's only female character miranda functions mostly as a representation of women instead of a representation of an oppressed colonial group
lines.name: English

lines.value: lorie leininger discussed in the previous section argues that miranda is part of a group subjugated by colonialism due to her gender but as far as direct connections to the british colonial process go miranda does not connect directly to the majority of theories
lines.name: English

lines.value: however miranda can be interpreted as an allegory for the softer side of colonialism portraying the more missionary aspect of colonisation attempts in that she tries to educate caliban instead of treating him as a sub human citizen like her father seems keen to
lines.name: English

lines.value: she also displays far more sympathy to the shipwrecked prince ferdinand than her father does and is eager to make his stay on the island as comfortable as possible
lines.name: English

lines.value: her attitude towards the discovered peoples as well as the newly discovered castaway sharply contrasts her father's inclination to conquer and destroy painting her not only as a compassionate figure but as one sympathetic to the colonial plight
lines.name: English

lines.value: in act i scene ii the lines spoken by miranda to caliban rebuking him for his ill treatment of prospero are frequently reassigned to prospero
lines.name: English

lines.value: editors and critics of the play felt that the speech was probably wrongly attributed to her either as a printing error or due to the fact that actors preferred that no character would remain silent too long on stage
lines.name: English

lines.value: critics also argue that the language used by miranda in this speech is out of character for her given her lack of knowledge of the world that makes caliban's behaviour so shocking as well as the fact that her style of speaking strongly resembles prospero's mannerisms
lines.name: English

lines.value: furthermore the use of anger and strong language removes the image of youth and innocence shakespeare cultivates of miranda and does not seem to be in keeping with her behaviour for the rest of the play
lines.name: English

lines.value: however others feel that miranda's speech here is correctly attributed
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the play progresses caliban refers to miranda as his mistress saying that it was miranda who explained to him what the moon and stars are
lines.name: English

lines.value: furthermore while critics acknowledge that the language in this particular speech is stronger than expected for miranda it is far weaker than prospero's form of address would be given the situation
lines.name: English

lines.value: her lines spoken at the end of act v scene i are the inspiration for the title of the novel brave new world
lines.name: English

lines.value: she appears as a character in aime cesaire's retelling of the tempest une tempete
lines.name: English

lines.value: clare savage a protagonist of michelle cliff's novel no telephone to heaven is frequently seen to be a modernised miranda
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the moons of uranus is named after her in keeping with other uranian moons named after shakespearian characters
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is reimagined as the narrator and protagonist of l jagi lamplighter's prospero's daughter trilogy of fantasy novels
lines.name: English

lines.value: cirque du soleil's amaluna portrays a loosely inspired miranda taking by basis shakespeare's miranda

lines.value: a degree completion program is an undergraduate academic program most frequently found in the united states and canada that is offered within an established university but designed for non traditional students

lines.value: degree completion programs are typically structured to allow persons who previously completed a substantial portion of the requirements for an undergraduate degree but who have been separated from the university setting for a period of time to complete the credit requirements needed to earn a bachelor's degree b.a either at an accelerated pace or a flexible schedule
lines.name: English

lines.value: the difference between credits previously earned and those required for the award of a ba are made up through a variety of methods depending on the sponsoring institution but typically include a combination of traditional university courses and clep examinations

lines.value: feilding maori aorangi is a town in the manawatu district of the north island of new zealand
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is located on state highway 54 20 kilometres north of palmerston north
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town is the seat of the manawatu district council
lines.name: English

lines.value: feilding has won the annual new zealand's most beautiful town award 16 times
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is an edwardian themed town
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town is currently extending its cbd beautification featuring paving and planter boxes on the footpaths on the main streets in the cbd including the realignment and beautification of fergusson street to the south street entrance of manfeild park
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town is a service town for the surrounding farming district
lines.name: English

lines.value: the feilding saleyards have been a vital part of the wider manawatu community for over 125 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: as transport systems improved and farming practices changed the need for small local saleyards all but disappeared leaving few major selling complexes in new zealand
lines.name: English

lines.value: manawatu is a diverse and fertile farming area with high production high stock carrying capacity and a stable climate
lines.name: English

lines.value: these factors make feilding saleyards a popular medium for many farmers
lines.name: English

lines.value: a unique aspect of feilding saleyards is their location in the centre of town
lines.name: English

lines.value: the manawatu plains on which the town is sited are very fertile land and as such it is a prosperous agricultural area
lines.name: English

lines.value: being located on the floodplain of a major river has its problems however and in february 2004 the town suffered extensive flooding
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2009 the horizons regional council commissioned a new flood protection scheme to prevent extensive flooding in the future
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town was named after colonel william ha feilding a director of the emigrants and colonists aid corporation ltd who negotiated the purchase of a 100000 acre 400 km² block of land from the wellington provincial government in 1871

lines.value: the first settlers arrived from great britain on 22 january 1874

lines.value: many of the commercial buildings were built in the 1900s edwardian era and have been restored and preserved over time

lines.value: saint gotthard or godehard 960 - 4 may 1038 ad ), also known as gothard or godehard the bishop was an anglo german bishop venerated as a saint
lines.name: English

lines.value: gotthard was born in 960 near niederaltaich in the diocese of passau
lines.name: English

lines.value: gotthard studied the humanities and theology at niederaltaich abbey where his father ratmund was a vassal of the canons
lines.name: English

lines.value: while at the abbey gotthard was placed under the guidance of uodalgisus
lines.name: English

lines.value: gotthard then resided at the archiepiscopal court of salzburg where he served as an ecclesiastical administrator
lines.name: English

lines.value: after traveling through various countries including italy gotthard completed his advanced studies under the guidance of liutfrid in the cathedral school at passau
lines.name: English

lines.value: he then joined the canons at niederaltaich in 990 and became their provost in 996
lines.name: English

lines.value: when henry ii of bavaria decided to transform the chapter house of niederaltaich into a benedictine monastery gotthard remained there as a novice subsequently becoming a monk there in 990 under the abbot ercanbertn
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 993 gotthard was ordained a priest in addition to becoming a prior and rector of the monastic school
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 996 when he was elected abbot gotthard introduced the cluniac reforms at niederaltaich
lines.name: English

lines.value: he helped revive the rule of st benedict which then provided abbots for the abbeys of tegernsee hersfeld and kremsmunster to restore benedictine observance under the patronage of henry ii holy roman emperor
lines.name: English

lines.value: he became bishop of hildesheim on 2 december 1022 being consecrated by aribo archbishop of mainz
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the fifteen years of his episcopal government while earning the respect of the clergy gotthard ordered the construction of some thirty churches
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite his advanced age he defended the rights of his diocese vigorously
lines.name: English

lines.value: after a brief sickness he died on 4 may 1038
lines.name: English

lines.value: gotthard's successors in the episcopate of hildesheim bertold 1119-30 and bernhard i 1130-53 pushed for his canonization
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was accomplished during the episcopate of bernard in 1131 and it took place at a synod in rheims
lines.name: English

lines.value: there pope innocent ii in the presence of bernard and saint norbert of xanten officially made gotthard a saint
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 4 may 1132 bernard translated gotthard's relics from the abbatial church to the cathedral at hildesheim
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 5 may the first liturgical festivity in honor of gotthard was celebrated
lines.name: English

lines.value: miracles were attributed to the relics
lines.name: English

lines.value: veneration of the saint spread to scandinavia switzerland and eastern europe
lines.name: English

lines.value: gotthard was invoked against fever dropsy childhood sicknesses hailstones the pain of childbirth and gout
lines.name: English

lines.value: furthermore niederaltaich abbey made its famous abbot the patron saint of the abbey's well known grammar school the st.-gotthard-gymnasium
lines.name: English

lines.value: gotthard also became the patron saint of traveling merchants and thus many churches and chapels were dedicated to him in the alps
lines.name: English

lines.value: his hospice for travellers near hildesheim the mauritiusstift became famous
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to an ancient ticinese tradition the little church in st gotthard pass san gottardo in the swiss alps was founded by galdino archbishop of milan r
lines.name: English

lines.value: goffredo da bussero however attributes the founding of the church to enrico di settala bishop of milan from 1213 to 1230
lines.name: English

lines.value: the hospice was entrusted to the care of the capuchin order in 1685 by federico ii visconti and later passed under the control of a confraternity of ticino
lines.name: English

lines.value: the term semiregular polyhedron or semiregular polytope is used variously by different authors
lines.name: English

lines.value: in its original definition it is a polyhedron with regular faces and a symmetry group which is transitive on its vertices which is more commonly referred to today as a uniform polyhedron this follows from thorold gosset's 1900 definition of the more general semiregular polytope
lines.name: English

lines.value: these polyhedra include since gosset other authors have used the term semiregular in different ways in relation to higher dimensional polytopes
lines.name: English

lines.value: e l elte provided a definition which coxeter found too artificial
lines.name: English

lines.value: coxeter himself dubbed gosset's figures uniform with only a quite restricted subset classified as semiregular
lines.name: English

lines.value: yet others have taken the opposite path categorising more polyhedra as semiregular
lines.name: English

lines.value: these include gosset's definition of semiregular includes figures of higher symmetry the regular and quasiregular polyhedra
lines.name: English

lines.value: some later authors prefer to say that these are not semiregular because they are more regular than that the uniform polyhedra are then said to include the regular quasiregular and semiregular ones
lines.name: English

lines.value: this naming system works well and reconciles many but by no means all of the confusions
lines.name: English

lines.value: in practice even the most eminent authorities can get themselves confused defining a given set of polyhedra as semiregular and or archimedean and then assuming or even stating a different set in subsequent discussions
lines.name: English

lines.value: assuming that one's stated definition applies only to convex polyhedra is probably the most common failing
lines.name: English

lines.value: coxeter cromwell and cundy & rollett are all guilty of such slips
lines.name: English

lines.value: in many works semiregular polyhedron is used as a synonym for archimedean solid
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example cundy & rollett 1961
lines.name: English

lines.value: we can distinguish between the facially regular and vertex transitive figures based on gosset and their vertically regular or versi regular and facially transitive duals
lines.name: English

lines.value: coxeter et al 1954 use the term semiregular polyhedra to classify uniform polyhedra with wythoff symbol of the form p q | r a definition encompassing only six of the archimedean solids as well as the regular prisms but not the regular antiprisms and numerous nonconvex solids
lines.name: English

lines.value: later coxeter 1973 would quote gosset's definition without comment thus accepting it by implication
lines.name: English

lines.value: eric weisstein robert williams and others use the term to mean the convex uniform polyhedra excluding the five regular polyhedra - including the archimedean solids the uniform prisms and the uniform antiprisms overlapping with the cube as a prism and regular octahedron as an antiprism
lines.name: English

lines.value: peter cromwell 1997 writes in a footnote to page 149 that in current terminology semiregular polyhedra refers to the archimedean and catalan archimedean dual solids
lines.name: English

lines.value: on page 80 he describes the thirteen archimedeans as semiregular while on pages 367 ff
lines.name: English

lines.value: he discusses the catalans and their relationship to the semiregular archimedeans
lines.name: English

lines.value: by implication this treats the catalans as not semiregular thus effectively contradicting or at least confusing the definition he provided in the earlier footnote
lines.name: English

lines.value: he ignores nonconvex polyhedra
lines.name: English

lines.value: charles yanofsky april 17 1925 new york city - march 16 2018 palo alto california was an american geneticist
lines.name: English

lines.value: born in new york yanofsky studied at the city college of new york and at yale university
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1964 yanofsky and colleagues established that gene sequences and protein sequences are colinear in bacteria
lines.name: English

lines.value: yanofsky showed that changes in dna sequence can produce changes in protein sequence at corresponding positions
lines.name: English

lines.value: his work revealed how controlled alterations in rna structure allow rna to serve as a regulatory molecule in both bacterial and animal cells
lines.name: English

lines.value: yanofsky was awarded the selman a waksman award in microbiology from the national academy of sciences in 1972 and was co recipient of the louisa gross horwitz prize from columbia university in 1976 with seymour benzer
lines.name: English

lines.value: yanofsky was elected a foreign member of the royal society in 1985 and was one of the recipients of the 2003 national medal of science awards
lines.name: English

lines.value: charles yanofsky was the morris herzstein professor of biology and molecular biology emeritus in the department of biology at stanford university
lines.name: English

lines.value: his former doctoral students include peter karp
lines.name: English

lines.value: esmond cardon walker january 9 1916 - november 28 2005 commonly known as e
lines.name: English

lines.value: cardon walker or card walker was a top executive at walt disney productions in the 1960s 1970s and 1980s
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was born in rexburg idaho
lines.name: English

lines.value: walker moved to los angeles california in 1934 where he attended ucla
lines.name: English

lines.value: after graduation he began his career at disney as a mailroom clerk in 1938
lines.name: English

lines.value: before long he stepped up the ladder and found himself in the camera department and later became a unit manager for short subjects
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1941 walker was forced to delay his disney career to serve in the united states navy during world war ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was the flight control officer flight deck officer aboard the aircraft carrier uss bunker hill cv-17 in the pacific theater from 1943-1945 surviving eight major battles
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the war he returned to the disney studio
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1956 he became the vice president of advertising and sales before being elected to the board of directors in 1960
lines.name: English

lines.value: after walt disney died in 1966 walker became executive vice president and chief operating officer
lines.name: English

lines.value: when walt's brother roy o disney died in 1971 walker became company president serving under chairman and ceo donn tatum
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november 1976 walker took over chief executive officer duties from tatum while retaining the responsibilities of president
lines.name: English

lines.value: finally in 1980 walker became chairman of the disney board upon tatum's retirement
lines.name: English

lines.value: walker himself retired as ceo three years later in february 1983 but stayed on as chairman until may 1 to oversee the opening of tokyo disneyland in japan
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a top disney executive walker played a major part in the early development of walt disney world in florida
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also sought to expand disney's presence to international territory
lines.name: English

lines.value: epcot and tokyo disneyland both opened under walker's leadership and he presided over the dedications of both parks
lines.name: English

lines.value: 59th street is an express station on the bmt fourth avenue line of the new york city subway
lines.name: English

lines.value: located at 59th street and fourth avenue in the brooklyn neighborhood of sunset park it is served by the n and r trains at all times as well as some w trains during rush hours
lines.name: English

lines.value: this station opened on june 22 1915
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is the southernmost four track express station with two island platforms
lines.name: English

lines.value: the outer local tracks continue along fourth avenue to bay ridge 95th street while the center express tracks turn east to become the bmt sea beach line
lines.name: English

lines.value: south of the station are two diamond crossovers allowing trains to cross from the outer track to the center track or vice versa
lines.name: English

lines.value: this station was overhauled in the late 1970s
lines.name: English

lines.value: elevator access for this station has been proposed for the late 2010s
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the installation of elevators has been delayed due to a column replacement project above this section of the fourth avenue line
lines.name: English

lines.value: both the column replacement and the elevator installation require temporary lane closures on fourth avenue a major artery
lines.name: English

lines.value: an elevator contract was supposed to be awarded in november 2016 but has been pushed back to july 2018
lines.name: English

lines.value: the street level entrances are at the southern end of the station with one entrance along either side of fourth avenue between 60th and 61st streets
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are also four exits to fourth avenue and 59th street with two each to either northern corner at the north end of the station
lines.name: English

lines.value: the basilica of our lady of perpetual help a major architectural landmark of brooklyn is nearby
lines.name: English

lines.value: immediately south of the station one can see tunnel stub headings running straight from the local tracks
lines.name: English

lines.value: they run for about 150 feet and would have been for a line to staten island via the staten island tunnel under the narrows which was aborted by mayor hylan before it was completed
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a maintenance of way shed that was built on the southbound trackway
lines.name: English

lines.value: the northbound trackway is unobstructed albeit much darker
lines.name: English

lines.value: the northbound trackway ends on a brick wall with evidence of some sort of space beyond
lines.name: English

lines.value: south of this station the bridge over the lirr bay ridge branch has four trackways with the outer tracks occupying the two western ones
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tracks of the bmt fourth avenue line are under the western half of fourth avenue at this point so that two additional tracks could be laid in the future if traffic ever warranted it.portions of what was to be two additional tracks for the fourth avenue subway south of this station were constructed by the then brooklyn edison company initially for use as circuit breaker chambers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the original proposal planned a connection from a point between 65th and 67th streets just south of the station running to arrietta street in tompkinsville staten island near the tompkinsville station on staten island
lines.name: English

lines.value: prairieville is a census designated place in ascension parish louisiana united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is south of baton rouge and north of gonzales
lines.name: English

lines.value: prairieville is an expanding bedroom suburb of baton rouge
lines.name: English

lines.value: its name is derived from the once plentiful pastures and prairies that were visible from highway 73 jefferson hwy and airline highway which is now covered with development
lines.name: English

lines.value: prairieville started off as a quiet community with few people
lines.name: English

lines.value: in recent decades prairieville has benefited from migration out of baton rouge with new residents particularly drawn to the area by its high performing public schools and low crime rate
lines.name: English

lines.value: prairieville had an official 2010 census population of 26895 inhabitants
lines.name: English

lines.value: if it incorporated it would be the largest city in ascension parish
lines.name: English

lines.value: prairieville is in one of the fastest growing areas in louisiana
lines.name: English

lines.value: prairieville's population is bigger than the parish's two largest incorporated cities donaldsonville 7436 and gonzales 9781 combined
lines.name: English

lines.value: prairieville is vulnerable to hurricanes and tropical systems due to its proximity to the coast of southeast louisiana
lines.name: English

lines.value: hurricane gustav caused major damage to the prairieville area many trees and power lines were down for weeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most notable local property was the phillips farm
lines.name: English

lines.value: the farmhouse is still a local landmark in prairieville although the original owner died in 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: the house is lined with live oaks and a white planked fence surrounds the grounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pasture was sold in 1992 at the start of the suburban development and a 250-resident subdivision named seven oaks surrounds the farm where the pastures were
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2006 the farmhouse was sold at auction following the death of dr carey a phillips
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tract of land including the house has been made into a cemetery now called oak lane memorial park
lines.name: English

lines.value: prairieville's latitude is 30.302n and the longitude is -90971w
lines.name: English

lines.value: richard sean salisbury born march 9 1963 is an american football analyst former nfl and cfl quarterback and actor
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is currently the host of the sean salisbury show on sb nation radio
lines.name: English

lines.value: salisbury attended orange glen high school in escondido california
lines.name: English

lines.value: during salisbury's senior year at orange glen high school he was a highly recruited quarterback choosing usc over ucla byu stanford notre dame cal arizona and arizona state
lines.name: English

lines.value: salisbury averaged 26.5 points per game his senior year and was a high school all american basketball player
lines.name: English

lines.value: ucla and usc both offered salisbury basketball scholarships
lines.name: English

lines.value: salisbury has three children dylan dodge and shea
lines.name: English

lines.value: during his ten year career salisbury was a member of the seattle seahawks indianapolis colts minnesota vikings san diego chargers and houston oilers as well as the winnipeg blue bombers of the canadian football league
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1988 salisbury led the winnipeg blue bombers to a grey cup championship over matt dunigan and the bc lions
lines.name: English

lines.value: after getting his start on the comedy central show battlebots salisbury went on to become an nfl analyst on espn appearing on sportscenter and nfl live
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2004 salisbury was offered a job with the arizona cardinals by his former coach and fellow co worker at espn dennis green to become their new quarterbacks coach
lines.name: English

lines.value: salisbury pondered for weeks but eventually declined and stayed on with espn
lines.name: English

lines.value: salisbury was hired as a consultant for the 2005 remake of the longest yard
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the set salisbury taught adam sandler proper quarterback mechanics cadences and footwork
lines.name: English

lines.value: sandler later offered salisbury a role in the 2006 film the benchwarmers
lines.name: English

lines.value: on may 9 2006 salisbury began broadcasting on espn radio 1000 chicago with steve rosenbloom
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also did guest spots on the espn classic comedy program cheap seats where he provided his signature breakdowns of the action in a more comedic manner
lines.name: English

lines.value: he has covered for mike golic on mike and mike in the morning
lines.name: English

lines.value: i can't believe i'm having my number retired like john elway marcus allen larry bird or magic johnson salisbury said

lines.value: in my own little world i will always cherish being the first at my high school to be honored like this after espn salisbury worked briefly for opensports.com and krld fm 105.3 the fan the cbs radio affiliate in dallas

lines.value: broadcast on wbfs tv and kdoc tv and streamed online at lflus.com

lines.value: george william foote 11 january 1850 &ndash 17 october 1915 was an english secularist and journal editor
lines.name: English

lines.value: george william foote was born in plymouth the son of william thomas foot a customs officer and ann winzar
lines.name: English

lines.value: in his reminiscences of charles bradlaugh he recalls coming to london in january 1868 with plenty of health and very little religion
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was taken to cleveland hall by a friend and heard mrs [[harriet law|[harriet] law]] knock the bible about delightfully
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was not what would be called a woman of culture but she had what some devotees of culchaw do not posses—a great deal of natural ability a few weeks later foote heard charles bradlaugh speaking at the hall
lines.name: English

lines.value: he became involved with the secularism freethought and republicanism joining the young men's secular association the national secular society and contributing to bradlaugh's national reformer
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1877 foote joined the anti bradlaughites in the breakaway british secular union
lines.name: English

lines.value: the split was caused by several factors bradlaugh's alleged autocratic style bradlaugh's association with annie besant and bradlaugh and besant's involvement in promoting birth control and neo malthusianism
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bsu was relatively short lived and foote himself was reconciled to bradlaugh within a few years becoming an nss vice president from 1882
lines.name: English

lines.value: the secularist a liberal weekly review 1876-1877 foote's first attempt to launch his own publication in collaboration with george jacob holyoake did not last long
lines.name: English

lines.value: in may 1881 foote started a serial publication called the freethinker which is still published
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result of contents of this journal foote was charged with blasphemy and eventually imprisoned for one year with hard labour
lines.name: English

lines.value: on receiving his sentence from mr justice north a devout catholic foote said with great deliberation to the judge my lord i thank you it is worthy of your creed
lines.name: English

lines.value: his description of this experience was published in 1886 as prisoner for blasphemy
lines.name: English

lines.value: once released foote continued to be active promoting his ideals writing books and pamphlets lecturing and debating
lines.name: English

lines.value: foote was well versed in literature and had extensive knowledge of ancient and contemporary writers and ecclesiastical history
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1890 foote succeeded bradlaugh as president of the national secular society and remained in that role for twenty five years
lines.name: English

lines.value: his death was related by chapman cohen in the freethinker 31 october 1915 when i saw him on the friday two days before his death he said i have had another setback but i am a curious fellow and may get all right again but he looked the fact of death in the face with the same courage and determination that he faced judge north many years ago
lines.name: English

lines.value: a few hours before he died he said calmly to those around him i am dying and when the end came his head dropped back on the pillow and with a quiet sigh as of one falling to sleep he passed away
lines.name: English
